data.question: What method was used to prepare a large single crystal for neutron diffraction measurements?
data.answer: Zinc oxide and 1,2,4-triazole were grinded in a mortar, phosphoric acid was added, and after maintaining at room temperature for 1 week, the single crystal was formed.

data.question: How were the proton conductivities of the coordination polymers measured?
data.answer: Proton conductivities were obtained by AC impedance measurement under dry N2 flow.

data.question: What was the maximum open circuit voltage (OCV) measured for the H2/O2 fuel cell comprising coordination polymer 5 as an electrolyte?
data.answer: The maximum open circuit voltage (OCV) was 0.88 V.

data.question: What indicates the presence of uncoordinated mobile H3PO4 and H2PO4- in the coordination polymers?
data.answer: The presence of uncoordinated mobile H3PO4 and H2PO4- is indicated by the 31P MAS NMR spectra showing additional large peak at 0.0 ppm and a small peak at -11.4 ppm.

data.question: Is the peak at 10.5째 in the XRD pattern of coordination polymer 2 indicative of a change in the structure around the defect sites?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the purpose of using a sealant gas barrier in the CPFC pellet preparation?
data.answer: The sealant gas barrier was used to separate air and H2 gas in the fuel cell experiment.

data.question: Did the CPFC pellet break after the fuel cell demonstration under humid condition?
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the effect of embedding H3PO4 into the defects on the proton conductivity of coordination polymer 5?
data.answer: Embedding H3PO4 into the defects significantly decreased the activation energy and enhanced the proton conductivity of coordination polymer 5.

data.question: What was used to fit the impedance profiles to obtain resistance values?
data.answer: ZView software was used for fitting of impedance profiles by means of an equivalent circuit to obtain the resistance values.

data.question: Was the water stability of coordination polymer 5 during the fuel cell demonstration attributed to its non-porous nature?
data.answer: True

data.question: What technique was employed to confirm the homogeneous distribution of H3PO4 in the particles of coordination polymer 5?
data.answer: Scanning electron microscope-energy dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (SEM-EDX) was used for confirming the homogeneous distribution of H3PO4 in the particles of coordination polymer 5.

data.question: Did the XRD patterns of coordination polymer 5 change from 30 to 150 째C?
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the role of 1,2,4-triazole in the synthesis of coordination polymers?
data.answer: 1,2,4-triazole was added to the phosphoric acid solution and zinc oxide mixture and grinded to form the coordination polymers.

data.question: How was the thermal stability of coordination polymer 5 confirmed?
data.answer: The thermal stability of coordination polymer 5 was confirmed through thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) profiles indicating stability up to ca. 180 째C.

data.question: Was the crystal structure of coordination polymer 5 intact up to 150 째C?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the main reason for the enhancement of proton conductivity in coordination polymer 5?
data.answer: The main reason for the enhancement of proton conductivity in coordination polymer 5 was the robust encapsulation of H3PO4 into the defects.

data.question: What was the effect of the mobile H3PO4, H2PO4-, and H2O on the dynamics of the protons in coordination polymer 5?
data.answer: The mobile H3PO4, H2PO4-, and H2O created a new proton hopping pathway, including the mobile carriers and HTz, and promoted the mobility of all protons from the monodentate H2PO4- and HTz.

data.question: Was the power density of the fuel cell with coordination polymer 5 as the electrolyte higher than that of recently reported supramolecular metallogel proton conductors?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the method used for the elemental analysis of zinc, phosphorus, carbon, and nitrogen in the coordination polymers?
data.answer: ICP-AES was used for determining the amount of zinc and phosphorus, while carbon and nitrogen contents were analyzed by a high-frequency combustion-IR absorption instrument and inert gas fusion thermal conductivity detector, respectively.

data.question: What was the significance of the peaks at 8.9 and 10.5 ppm in the 1H ultrafast MAS NMR spectra for coordination polymer 5?
data.answer: The peaks at 8.9 and 10.5 ppm in the 1H ultrafast MAS NMR spectra for coordination polymer 5 were significant as they were assigned to the protons of mobile uncoordinated H2O, and H3PO4 and H2PO4-, respectively.
